text:
Can anyone assist me regarding my requirement towards Custom Object API
I have created multiple custom objects and have records inside each custom objects and would like to Pull these records from Custom Object API

Hello all,
I want to create workflow to internal email notification. The idea is I create custom object (i.e NPS_Notifications) that contains company_id, company_name, admin_id, admin_name, admin_email, nps_score. The goal is if the nps_score each company below threshold, then automate notify the admin email each company. Is it possible to create workflow like this or not? Thanks in advance..

Hi all,
Anyone know about HubSpot APIs?
Use the APIs - Any Custom OBJECTS can be accessed via API

Hello, I’m trying to create an association between to custom objects but I get a 405. What I send is something like this:

`PUT crm/v3/objects/2-5580615/1061191569/associations/2-5185508/1067150234/course_to_student?hapikey=xxxx`

Basically is:

`PUT crm/v3/objects/fromObjectTypeId/objectId/associations/toObjectTypeId/objectId/course_to_student?hapikey=xxxx`

I know that I can use these objectTypeIds because when I get the schemas I see this relationship

```{
  "fromObjectTypeId": "2-5580615",
  "toObjectTypeId": "2-5185508",
  "name": "course_to_student",
  "cardinality": "ONE_TO_MANY",
  "inverseCardinality": "ONE_TO_MANY",
  "id": "41",
  "createdAt": null,
  "updatedAt": null
 }```
Can someone tell me what I’m doing wrong? thanks in advance!
maybe try using the association ID instead of the name in the url? so 41 instead of course_to_student
Hi <@U034X9K26MD>, thanks a lot for your answer. Unfortunately, even by using `41` instead of `course_to_student` I always get a 405

I was able to resolve by using the endpoint of the batch associations:


`POST */crm/v3/associations/{fromObjectType}/{toObjectType}/batch/create*`

Hey Stephen, when you say “build an endpoint” am I right to assume you’re using CMS serverless functions? If so, it may be an issue of execution time/the function timing out: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions#:~:text=Execution%20limits>

:wave: Hello, team! I think I may use a help of some of you.

I want to change the currency string to number in my workflow. This I figured, then I want to property Price per month assign to property Pricing price so I can get benchmarks etc.. I have tried with some code founded on HubSpot community but nothing really works. Could someone help me?

And from what I figured I need API to do so.

:wave: Hello, everyone!  Sorry to drop in and start with a question but not sure where else to go...
I am using the Timeline Events API to integrate our SaaS app into HubSpot and create events such as Trial Started, Trial Ended, New Customer, Customer Churned, etc...

This is critical to trigger workflows, emails, segmentations and notifications within HubSpot.  However it seems the only authorization method is Oauth2 bearer code.  Although I have no issue coding the logic to refresh token if the token is expired, if the refresh token also expires (for some reason) our app can't log itself back in via a login page.  It seems the Oauth2 Client Credentials is not implemented in the HS API and using API Key is not allowed.
The question is then: How does anyone do machine to machine API integration with the Timeline Events API?

<#C2YHAHB6K|api> Hi, I am getting an error when trying to connect to the HubSpot api via the php client. However, I am getting the error "HubSpot\Factory" can not be found. Here is my code

`use HubSpot\Factory;`
`use HubSpot\Client\Crm\Contacts\ApiException;`

`$hubSpot = Factory::createWithApiKey('apikey');`

`$response = $hubSpot->crm()->contacts()->basicApi()->getPage();`

What am I doing wrong here? I have followed the installation instructions from the GitHub Repo here: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-php>

But am having the most difficult time. Any help is appreciated.
